considering if the evidence could have been available earlier

cause_of_action: Dispute over whether Apotex could introduce a revised product monograph after relying on the original one throughout the proceedings.
application_details: Apotex initially defended its original product monograph but later sought to introduce a revised version.
decision_reasoning: Allowing the revised monograph at such a late stage would not serve justice.
result_of_case: The Prothonotary's decision was overturned, and the applicants were awarded costs.
procedure_followed: Motion by applicants to overturn the Prothonotary's decision; analysis of relevant rules and procedural history; determination of whether justice was served.

mootness: Applications T-1520-01, T-1521-01, and T-1522-01 were struck out due to mootness
cause_of_action: Pauktuutit sought judicial review of Crown decisions excluding them from consultations and funding related to constitutional accords and health initiatives
procedure_followed: The Crown moved to strike out all four judicial review applications. The court analyzed each application based on mootness, factual foundation, and time limitations
result_of_case: Three applications were dismissed, while one (T-1523-01) was allowed to proceed
relevant_statute: Section 18.1(2) of the Federal Court Act imposes a 30-day limitation period
decision_reasoning: Judicial review applications can be dismissed for mootness if they no longer affect parties' rights or lack a factual basis
